intro: Trichinium corymbosum, commonly known as the common false nettle, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a mild, aromatic scent. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Trichinium corymbosum is not toxic but can cause skin irritation in some individuals.
